item.title: tidytuesday
item.description: Continuing to explore sparklines for #TidyTuesday, looking at daily messages in public channels on the #Slack community of @R4DScommunity code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-29

item.title: tidytuesday
item.description: Trying win-loss sparklines for #TidyTuesday, quite happy with the result code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/blob/master/week-28

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: #TidyTuesday and I looked at video games franchises and revenue just from the actual video games: Second submission for this week's #TidyTuesday, training my circular plot muscles for another challenge :) The labels above the circles are tiny, couldn't come up with any better solution, any feedback or idea is welcome! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-27

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: UFO sightings for #TidyTuesday and I look at the top 10 cities in the world with the most reported encounters (all in the US). I didn't do any data cleaning at all, so the numbers shown may not correspond to reality üòÑ code

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Christmas Bird Counts for #TidyTuesday and I looked at easily-confused birds according to Mass Audubon I don't know a thing about birds, so‚Ä¶ ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è code: github

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Meteorites for #TidyTuesday. Abandoned a couple of too ambitious attempts and found inspiration at https://uk.rs-online.com/web/generalDisplay.html?id=earths-biggest-meteorites Update: Same plot with a slightly bigger map. Thanks @CedScherer for the suggestion, it definitely looks better! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-24 #rstats #ggplot2 #dataviz

item.title: #SWDchallenge
item.description: First #SWDchallenge submission ever. Went for a minimalist, monochrome plot with lots of white space and as little text as possible and an @Apple rebranding came to mind #dataviz (This is fake data for an illustrative branding exercise)

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Instant ramen reviews by @theramenrater for #TidyTuesday. Good luck reading the text, but couldn't help it, it was too much fun making this plot! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-23

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: #TidyTuesday! Food pairings for the top 5 varieties, as recommended by reviewers. I don't like the lines in the plot but couldn't find anything better. The code is hacky and messy but I learned a ton with this one! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-22 As a bonus, here is a thing I drew many, many years ago.

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: A plot about Global Plastic Waste for this week's #TidyTuesday. I sacrificed accuracy for looks and I liked it :) code

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Third and last submission for #NobelPrize #TidyTuesday. Looked at shared prizes across the 6 categories, really like the result. Inspired by @spren9er‘s plot “Still a man's world", and got big help from his code code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-20

item.title: #tidytuesday
